sections.heading: Overview
content: Sam is an avid runner and cyclist with a master?s degree in exercise physiology from Georgia State University in Atlanta. He has completed four marathons, numerous 10K and 5K races and many triathlons. Sam currently works for USA Cycling as its Applied Sport Science Manager. In addition to his duties with USA Cycling, he trains marathon runners for the Joints in Motion program that raises money for the Arthritis Foundation. He also works as an adjunct fitness consultant for the Center for Creative Leadership (a non-profit leadership development organization) located in Colorado Springs. Sam is certified as a Health/Fitness Instructor (HFI) through the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM). He also has coaching certificates from USA Track and Field (Level I) and an Expert Coaching license from USA Cycling.
